name: great_demo
description: A framework for discovery-focused demos that align with customer business outcomes

components.name: Critical Business Issues
components.description: Understanding of top-level business challenges and objectives

subComponents.name: Business Challenge Identification
subComponents.description: How clearly the individual's top-level business challenge is documented

scoringCriteria.excellent: Critical business issue clearly identified with specific quarterly/annual goal context
scoringCriteria.good: Business challenge is well-articulated with clear business context
scoringCriteria.fair: Some business challenge mentioned but lacks specificity or context
scoringCriteria.poor: Business challenge is vague, assumed, or not clearly identified

coachingTips: Ask about current quarterly/annual business objectives
Connect challenges to specific measurable outcomes
Avoid assuming challenges - always verify with customer

subComponents.name: Risk Assessment
subComponents.description: Understanding of what puts the business objective at risk

scoringCriteria.excellent: Clear understanding of specific risks threatening the business objective
scoringCriteria.good: Risks are identified with reasonable detail and business impact
scoringCriteria.fair: Some risks mentioned but lack clarity or urgency
scoringCriteria.poor: Risks are not discussed or only vaguely referenced

coachingTips: Probe for what could prevent success
Understand timeline pressures and constraints
Quantify impact of risks where possible

components.name: Problems / Reasons
components.description: Understanding of why the challenge is a problem and current state difficulties

subComponents.name: Problem Root Cause
subComponents.description: Understanding of why the business challenge is difficult to achieve

scoringCriteria.excellent: Root causes clearly identified with specific examples and business impact
scoringCriteria.good: Problems are well-explained with clear reasoning and some examples
scoringCriteria.fair: Some problem explanation but lacks depth or specific examples
scoringCriteria.poor: Problem reasons are vague, surface-level, or not clearly explained

coachingTips: Use '5 Why' technique to get to root causes
Ask for specific examples and situations
Connect problems to business impact

subComponents.name: Current Process Understanding
subComponents.description: How well current methods and processes are understood

scoringCriteria.excellent: Current processes thoroughly understood with specific workflow details
scoringCriteria.good: Current approach is clearly documented with reasonable detail
scoringCriteria.fair: Some understanding of current process but lacks detail
scoringCriteria.poor: Current process is not well understood or documented

coachingTips: Map current workflow step by step
Identify where current process breaks down
Understand resource and time constraints

components.name: Specific Capabilities
components.description: Understanding of required capabilities from the prospect's perspective

subComponents.name: Capability Requirements
subComponents.description: How clearly the needed capabilities are stated from prospect's viewpoint

scoringCriteria.excellent: Required capabilities clearly stated in prospect's language with specific use cases
scoringCriteria.good: Capabilities are well-defined from prospect's perspective
scoringCriteria.fair: Some capability requirements mentioned but lack prospect's perspective
scoringCriteria.poor: Capability requirements are vendor-focused or not clearly from prospect's viewpoint

coachingTips: Let customer define requirements in their terms
Avoid leading with vendor capabilities
Focus on business outcomes, not technical features

subComponents.name: Use Case Alignment
subComponents.description: How well capabilities align with specific prospect use cases

scoringCriteria.excellent: Capabilities clearly connected to specific customer use cases and workflows
scoringCriteria.good: Good alignment between capabilities and customer scenarios
scoringCriteria.fair: Some connection made but could be more specific to customer context
scoringCriteria.poor: Capabilities are not well-connected to customer's actual use cases

coachingTips: Ask for specific scenarios where capability is needed
Connect requirements to actual workflow steps
Validate understanding with real examples

components.name: Positive Business Outcomes
components.description: Understanding of business value drivers and risks of inaction

subComponents.name: Positive Outcomes Identification
subComponents.description: Clear articulation of benefits, value, and positive impacts of solving the problem

scoringCriteria.excellent: Multiple positive outcomes clearly identified with quantified benefits and business impact
scoringCriteria.good: Positive outcomes are clearly stated with some quantification or business context
scoringCriteria.fair: Some positive outcomes mentioned but lack detail or business impact clarity
scoringCriteria.poor: Positive outcomes are vague, generic, or not explicitly discussed

coachingTips: Quantify benefits wherever possible
Connect benefits to business objectives
Include both hard and soft benefits

subComponents.name: Negative Consequences Understanding
subComponents.description: Recognition of risks, costs, and negative impacts of not solving the problem

scoringCriteria.excellent: Clear understanding of risks and costs of inaction with specific examples and quantified impact
scoringCriteria.good: Negative consequences are identified with reasonable detail and business context
scoringCriteria.fair: Some risks mentioned but lack specificity or urgency
scoringCriteria.poor: Negative consequences are not discussed or only vaguely referenced

coachingTips: Explore cost of maintaining status quo
Identify competitive disadvantages of inaction
Connect consequences to business timeline

components.name: Required Capabilities
components.description: Understanding of what capabilities or features are needed to bridge the gap

subComponents.name: Capability Identification
subComponents.description: How well the required capabilities to solve the problem are identified

scoringCriteria.excellent: Specific capabilities clearly identified with connection to business needs and use cases
scoringCriteria.good: Required capabilities are well-defined with clear business justification
scoringCriteria.fair: Some capability identification but lacks specificity or business connection
scoringCriteria.poor: Required capabilities are vague or not clearly connected to business needs

coachingTips: Connect capabilities to specific business problems
Prioritize must-have vs. nice-to-have capabilities
Validate capabilities against use cases

subComponents.name: Integration Requirements
subComponents.description: Understanding of how solution must integrate with existing systems and processes

scoringCriteria.excellent: Integration requirements clearly defined with specific system and process details
scoringCriteria.good: Integration needs are well-understood with reasonable technical detail
scoringCriteria.fair: Some integration requirements mentioned but lack technical specificity
scoringCriteria.poor: Integration requirements are not discussed or poorly understood

coachingTips: Map existing technology stack
Identify critical integration points
Understand data flow requirements

components.name: Technical Proof Points
components.description: Evidence that the solution can deliver the required capabilities effectively

subComponents.name: Solution Demonstration
subComponents.description: How effectively the solution capabilities are demonstrated using customer context

scoringCriteria.excellent: Solution demonstrated using customer's specific data, workflows, and requirements
scoringCriteria.good: Demonstration clearly connects to customer needs with relevant examples
scoringCriteria.fair: Some customization of demonstration but could be more customer-specific
scoringCriteria.poor: Generic demonstration not tailored to customer's specific situation

coachingTips: Use customer's actual data when possible
Focus demo on discovered requirements only
Address specific use cases identified in discovery

subComponents.name: Technical Validation
subComponents.description: Evidence that technical requirements and constraints are addressed

scoringCriteria.excellent: Technical capabilities thoroughly validated against customer requirements with proof points
scoringCriteria.good: Technical validation provided with reasonable evidence and examples
scoringCriteria.fair: Some technical validation but lacks depth or specific evidence
scoringCriteria.poor: Technical capabilities not validated or only superficially addressed

coachingTips: Address technical concerns proactively
Provide concrete evidence of capabilities
Show integration scenarios
